subject: Management
title: Collective Intelligence
description: A quick win: understand Collective Intelligence.

hook.text: Groups of average thinkers consistently outperformed solo geniuses on complex problems at MIT.

buildup.text: Collective intelligence is a team's ability to solve problems better than any individual member.

discovery.text: Woolley's research: collective intelligence depends on social sensitivity, equal participation, and more women.

twist.text: Average IQ of members didn't predict team intelligence. Social dynamics did.

climax.text: Build a team that listens well, shares airtime, and reads each other's emotions.

punchline.text: A smart team isn't smart people. It's people who think well together.

quiz.question: What predicts collective intelligence in teams?
options: Social sensitivity, equal participation, and group dynamics
The average IQ of individual team members
Having one extremely intelligent leader who guides others
